medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ), localized after a day of vague abdominal discomfort.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with vague and diffuse abdominal discomfort 1 day prior, then became localized to the RLQ last evening. The patient experienced subjective fevers and diarrhea about 5 days ago, which resolved prior to the onset of abdominal pain. Denies nausea/vomiting, anorexia, fevers, chills, or sweats.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Behavior problems in childhood; multiple suspensions in middle school, but no concerns since then. No previous surgeries.
